author: legozander
title: Really cool
review: My dad came home from germany with a nice surprise for me and my brother i got kazi and a rhotaka pack and my bro got a zamor pack and a rahaga. But anyway back to the review.Kazi is quite cool and he comes with handy parts and a quite a few spare parts for such a small set.The fact that you cant move the legs is a bit of a problem but they can be modified so they can move like the other voya nui matoran.All the parts in kazi are not new and have been used in other sets before so dont be expecting new bits or something like that.His mask is exactly the same as toa Nujus and if your thinking whether you should buy kazi or not get him now. He is well worth your money.

author: Gus_263
title: Good builted for a matoran
review: This white matoran of Voya Nui is good builted for a simple matoran and also have a considerable size. This set includes 25 usable pieces and also a white mask from nuju and two guurahk's weapons, that be fixed very well in this matoran, and do a good design. The set is also really playable, much easy to build and to have some fun (comparable to small sets that is good). Overall i rate the matoran Kazi 5/5

author: DarthVader_
title: Cool Matoran.
review: This is a really cool matoran.  I do not like that he does not have a head.  I wish he had a head, because when you take off the mask, he looks like a headless monster!  I like him alot though, besides the head thing!

author: bionicle101
title: The best Voya Nui Matoran!
review:
Okay, I got this set in the 2006 Matoran collection. When I built Kazi, I knew he'd be the best. 

Pros:

Nuju's mask

Lots of "Playability"

Good weapons

Tall for Voya Nui Matoran


Cons:

Stupid head piece (Just a hand piece!)



Overall, a 5/5

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Matoran) - Kazi Review
review:
This is a fun little set to have and fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has only 2 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This figure has some nice parts: We get two weapons, two nice looking feet and another mask which we've seen on Toa Metru Nuju. All pieces are great for future MOC's (My own creations) and/or brickfilms for sure.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we don't have to complain about stickers as well.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8722-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can be adjusted. I think the design of this figure is really simple and cool - even if it doesn't have a lot of play features. As I told you in the beginning: This is a fun little set to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: tkettle9719
title: Matoran of Voya Nui
review:
I got Kazi for 4 dollars at Target many years ago, and find him to be one of the coolest little Matoran ever. He's small, but has a certain commanding feel to him.

Pros

  • -The reusing of Nuju's old headpiece is awesome.
  • -The clever use of smaller accessory pieces from other sets is used to great effect here.
  • …

Cons

  • -He seems really short, even for a Matoran.
  • -The use of a regular standard headpiece with eyeslots would have been a better choice.
  • …

This is a nice little ice Matoran, with whom I am well pleased with. It's inexpensive, small, and somewhat cute. Buy a couple if you don't have one.
